text:
Milton Viorst (born 1930) is an American journalist. He was born New Jersey. He studied at Rutgers University. Viorst is married to author Judith Viorst.
From 1956 to 1993, Viorst often worked with "The New Yorker", "Foreign Affairs", "Harper's Magazine", "The Atlantic", "The New York Times Magazine", "The Washington Post", and "The Wall Street Journal".
In 1968, he signed the "Writers and Editors War Tax Protest" pledge to refuse tax payments in protest against the Vietnam War. His writing landed him on the Nixon list.
